name: Microserver v1.2.6
body:
# New in Microserver v1.2.6

- Bug fixes and better debugging logs

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

# Dependency upgrades

# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

#### Microserver for Spring Boot

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.oath.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-spring-boot</artifactId>
      <version>1.2.6</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Grizzly with Jersey

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.oath.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-grizzly-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>1.2.6</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Tomcat with Jersey

``` xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.oath.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-tomcat-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>1.2.6</version>
    </dependency>

```

Other modules are available in Maven Central

### Gradle dependency

#### Microserver Spring Boot

``` groovy
      compile group: 'com.oath.microservices', name:'micro-spring-boot', version:'1.2.6'
```

#### Microserver grizzly-with-jersey

``` groovy
     compile group: 'com.oath.microservices', name:'micro-grizzly-with-jersey', version:'1.2.6'
```

#### Microserver tomcat-with-jersey

``` groovy
     compile group: 'com.oath.microservices', name:'micro-tomcat-with-jersey', version:'1.2.6'
```

name: Microserver v1.2.4
body:
# New in Microserver v1.2.4

- Generic support for object storage in distributed cache.

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

# Dependency upgrades
- Renamed micro-elasticache plugin to micro-memcached
- Beans transientCache and memcachedClient are no longer exposed. DistributedCacheFactory must be used instead.

# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

#### Microserver for Spring Boot

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.oath.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-spring-boot</artifactId>
      <version>1.2.3</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Grizzly with Jersey

``` xml

      <groupId>com.oath.microservices</groupId>
```

name: Microserver 0.91.11
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.1

- Bug fixes

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

# Dependency upgrades

# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

#### Microserver for Spring Boot

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-spring-boot</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.11</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Grizzly with Jersey

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-grizzly-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.11</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Tomcat with Jersey

``` xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-tomcat-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.11</version>
    </dependency>

```

Other modules are available in Maven Central

### Gradle dependency

#### Microserver Spring Boot

``` groovy
      compile group: 'com.aol.microservices', name:'micro-spring-boot', version:'0.91.11'
```

name: Microserver v0.91.10
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.10

- Bug fixes

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

# Dependency upgrades

# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

name: Role based authorization support for AWS clients hosted in AWS.
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.9

- Role based authorization support for AWS clients hosted in AWS.
A new config `s3.useDefaultChain` is added to support role based authentication for hosted AWS clients. If this is set to `true` then the S3 access will use instance roles where your client is hosted on AWS. For full details on the default AWS chain, see the [official AWS docs](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaSDK/latest/javadoc/com/amazonaws/auth/DefaultAWSCredentialsProviderChain.html)

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

name: Improved Timers and Application Registry Filter
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.8

- Sliding time window array reservoir
Timer metrics now use SlidingTimeWindowArrayReservoir (from Dropwizard) instead of the default ExponentiallyDecayingReservoir.  This makes viewing the duration of requests in applications succh as Datadog easier to understand.

- Application registry filter
a filter can be used on the url to lookup only a certain field of the manifest e.g.
/list/port=8080


[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

name: Generic Events not supported in micro-server
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.5

GenericEvent to trigger/log arbitrary events 
InstantGauge to use with datadog 
Bug fixes

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

## Issue list
- 0.91.5 
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/360
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/361
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/364

# Dependency upgrades


# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

name: v0.91.1 of Microserver
body:
# New in Microserver v0.91.1

Upgrade to cyclops 9.0.0-MI2

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

## Issue list
- 0.91.1 
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/milestone/34?closed=1


# Dependency upgrades


# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

#### Microserver for Spring Boot

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-spring-boot</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.1</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Grizzly with Jersey

``` xml

    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-grizzly-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.1</version>
    </dependency>
```

#### Microserver Tomcat with Jersey

``` xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-tomcat-with-jersey</artifactId>
      <version>0.91.1</version>
    </dependency>

```

Other modules are available in Maven Central

### Gradle dependency

# New in Microserver v0.90.4

Various minor fixes

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

## Issue list
- 0.90.4 
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/298
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/309
S3 Client Memory Leak fix https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/303

# Dependency upgrades
- Spring to 4.3.7.RELEASE
- Spring Boot to 1.4.5.RELEASE


# What is Microserver?

[Microserver](http://micro-server.io/) is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

name: v0.89 of Microserver - Publishing metrics to Datadog
body:
# New in Microserver v0.89
- [micro-metrics-datadog](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-metrics-datadog) : Publishes captured DropWizard metrics to Datadog. Integrates with micro-event-metrics to capture and publish large range of service metrics. (Similar plugins are easy to create for other data service providers)
- micro-event-metrics : Integrate HealthChecks from DropWizard metrics
- micro-application-register : Integrate health check information, change default update to every second, allow an external port to be published, support publishing of CPU memory stats via SIGAR (micro-machine-stats plugin)

[Microserver website](http://micro-server.io)

## Issue list
- 0.89 https://github.com/aol/micro-server/milestone/25?closed=1

name: v0.88 of Microserver - event metrics reporting and service registry enhancements
body:
# New in Microserver v0.88
- micro-event-metrics : captures stats on service events and publishes them to DropWizard metrics
- micro-application-registry : additional info sent for service discovery (service manifest)

## Event Metrics

Captures metrics on Requests, Scheduled Jobs and Errors.
Publishes them to DropWizard metrics where they can be exported to graphana / Datadog etc.

name: v0.87 of Microserver : Stream across services, Standardized error handling
body:
# New in Microserver v0.87
- Use Java 8 Streams (or reactive-streams Publishers) to Stream data between Microservices.
- Standardized error codes, error handling and health checks
- Decisioning for micro-async-data-writer and loader tasks (e.g. have only an elected leader execute)
- DistributedMap abstraction (backed by S3 or Couchbase)

## Streaming across Services with micro-reactive

``` java
@GET
@Produces("application/json")
@Path("/infinite-boo")
public Response boo() {
       return ReactiveResponse.publishAsJson(ReactiveSeq.generate(() -> "boo!"));

}
@GET
@Produces("application/json")
@Path("/infinite-boo-jdk")
public Response booJDK() {
       return ReactiveResponse.streamAsJson(Stream.generate(() -> "boo!"));

}
```

To Stream in output from our infinetely Streaming Rest end points we can write

``` java
new ReactiveRequest(1000, 1000).getJsonStream("http://localhost:8080/simple-app/single/infinite-boo",String.class)
                               .forEach(System.err::println);
```

## Standardized error handling with micro-error-codes

Features
1. ErrorCode class for defining error codes
2. ErrorBus and abstract BaseException type that accepts ErrorCode and posts errors through the ErrorBus
3. HealthCheck service that tracks error state of an application (e.g. Ok, Errors, Fatal)
4. Configurable Rest end point for viewing status & errors

Define errors - FATAL denotes an unrecoverable failure

``` java

public interface Errors {
    public final static ErrorCode QUERY_FAILURE = ErrorCode.error(1, "User {0} missing", Severity.CRITICAL);
    public final static ErrorCode SYSTEM_FAILURE = ErrorCode.error(2, "data {0} mismatch, corruption likely", Severity.FATAL);
}

```

Throwing an Exception will ensure the error is tracked via an Error EventBus, and health check status will be updated.

``` java

try{

}catch(Exception e){
        throw new InvalidStateException(Errors.SYSTEM_FAILURE.format(systemRecord),e);
}
```

# Dependency upgrades

None this time

# What is Microserver?

Microserver is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

name: v0.86 of Microserver : micro-s3 enhancements for backing Microservices with S3 (or couchbase) as a core data store.
body:
# New in Microserver v0.86

0.86 introduces significant enhancements for building Microservices backed by Amazon’s S3 storage (or alternatively Couchbase), as well as enhancements for managing multiple distributed locks simultaneously and version increases to Spring and Spring Boot.

# micro-s3 enhancements
- New APIs for CRUD operations via S3Reader, S3Writer and S3Deleter.
- Support for S3 backed Manifest Comparator pattern.

Manifest Comparator pattern allows Microservices to load large datasets asynchronously into memory only on version changes.

# micro-async-data-loader

This plugin should be used in conjunction with an implementation of the abstract micro-manifest-comparator plugin (either micro-s3 or micro-couchbase) - it automatically loads data asynchronously into any configured ManfestComparators.

# micro-async-data-writer

This plugin should be used in conjunction with an implementation of the abstract micro-manifest-comparator plugin (either micro-s3 or micro-couchbase) - it helps users writer data asynchronously to a data store (S3 / Couchbase) to be read by a consuming service.

# micro-dist-lock

Offers improved support for managing multiple distributed locks within a single service (via two mechanisms either by creating simple LockProvider Beans or by creating DistributedLockManager instances). Provides a Rest end point for checking if your service has the lock or not.

# Dependency upgrades
- Spring to 4.2.7.RELEASE
- Spring Boot to 1.3.6.RELEASE

# What is Microserver?

Microserver is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

name: 0.85.1 of Microserver : FilterConfiguration and Servlet Configuration enhancement for Microservice Plugin developments
body:
# New in Microserver v0.85.1

0.85.1 upgrades a lot of the core dependencies in Microserver (see list below).

# micro-core enhancements

Primary functional enhancements are to the FilterConfiguration and ServletConfiguration interfaces. These are the recommended way to create Filters and Servlets, as they will work across both plain ol' Spring and Spring Boot based Microservices. The interfaces have been enhanced so that either a Filter Object / Filter Class can be returned (and Servlet Object or Servlet Class).

# mico-curator enhancements

Curator version has been increased and a race condition bug fixed.

# Dependency upgrades
- hibernate to 5.10.Final
- hibernateValidator  to 5.2.4.Final  
- spring Data JPA to 1.10.1.RELEASE
- hikariCP to 2.4.6
- curator to 3.1.0
- tomcat to 9.0.0.M6

# What is Microserver?

Microserver is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. name: v0.84 of Microserver : Spring Boot, S3, JAX-RS, CORs enhancements
body:
# New in Microserver v0.84

# micro-spring-boot enhancements
- All Microserver Module configuration options respected
- Improved error warning with MicroserverApp#start called
- Support for Servlets, Filters and ContextListeners configured in Microserver Plugins

# JAX-RS enhancements
- Ability to inject Spring Beans as JAX-RS resources via the JaxRsResource annotation (which extends Component) or JaxRsResourceWrapper (for use with Configuration Beans)

# Interface enhancements
- Plugin and Module interfaces return JDK collection interfaces rather than extended collection types

# micro-S3 enhancements
- ‘Directory’ Cleaner facility added
- Ability to upload / create an empty file

# CORs Filter enhancement

Greater configurability of the eBay CORs filter

# Dependency upgrades
- Spring Boot to 1.3.5.RELEASE
- Spring to 4.2.6.RELEASE

# What is Microserver?

Microserver is a plugin engine for building Spring and Spring Boot based microservices. Microserver supports pure microservice and micro-monolith development styles. The micro-monolith style involves packaging multiple services into a single deployment - offering developers the productivity of microservice development without the operational risk. This can help teams adopt a Microservices architecture on projects that are currently monoliths.

Microserver plugins are orthogonal to Microservices. They solve a common problem in Microservice development where by services are broken up and deployed separately but code remains entangled in a monolithic common library. By making use of a plugin system that follows the same modular archictectural principals as microservice development, teams can keep cross-service concerns and infrastructure in properly size, coherent and cohesive plugin modules. 

Checkout the [available plugins here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server) : each plugin has it's own readme.md

![screen shot 2016-05-06 at 12 30 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/15588807/8da91440-2387-11e6-979b-f24d456541f5.png)

name: v0.80 of Microserver : full Spring Boot Support
body:
# New in Microserver v0.80

A spring-based platform for plugin based Microservices development.

## New plugins

## micro-spring-boot

The micro-spring-boot plugin allows full-stack integration with Spring Boot (in contrast to the pre-existing Spring Boot plugin which supports only Spring Boot backends). With micro-spring-boot you can run Spring Boot managed servers with Microserver Jersey configuration and plugins.
- [micro-spring-boot](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-spring-boot) and  [micro-log4j example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-spring-boot/src/test/java/app)

### An example Spring Boot Jersey App with Microserver

``` java

@MicroSpringBoot //configure this package as the base for autoscan
//optionally use @Microserver here for more configuration options
public class SimpleExample {

    RestClient rest = new RestClient(10_000,1_000);


    public static void main (String[] args){

        new MicroserverApp(()-> "simple-app"); //note unlike traditional microserver apps, there is no need to call start or run here

        assertThat(rest.get("http://localhost:8080/simple-app/status/ping"),equalTo("ok"));

    }



}
@Rest
@Path("/status")
public class SimpleResource{



    @GET
    @Produces("text/plain")
    @Path("/ping")
    public String ping() {

        return "ok";
    }


}
```

## Feature Tracking
- S3 plugin should allow users to specify a region for S3 client enhancement #151 opened 7 days ago by kewangie 
- micro-hibernate shouldn't depend on micro-hikaricp bug #146 opened 14 days ago by kewangie 
- micro-boot integration - Allow micro-boot apps to use Spring Boot severs and front ends enhancement #128 opened on Dec 14, 2015 by johnmcclean-aol 

## Dependency updates
- Spring to 
- Spring Boot to 

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

#### Microserver for Spring Boot

``` xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
      <artifactId>micro-spring-boot</artifactId>
      <version>0.80</version>
    </dependency>
```


body:
# New in Microserver v0.79.2

## New plugins

## micro-log4j

Add Rest end points to allow the log level to be changed progrmatically, configure a scheduled job to ensure any changes are temporary.
- [micro-log4j](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-log4j) and  [micro-log4j example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-log4j/src/test/java/app)

Add Rest end points to allow the log level to be changed progrmatically, configure a scheduled job to ensure any changes are temporary.

name: v0.79 of Microserver
body:
# New in Microserver v0.79

## micro-tomcat & micro-tomcat-with-jersey

Now you can use Tomcat or Grizzly with Microserver.
- [micro-tomcat](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-tomcat) and  [micro-tomcat example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-tomcat/src/test/java/app)
- [micro-tomcat-with-jersey](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-tomcat-with-jersey) and  [micro-tomcat-with-jersey example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-tomcat-with-jersey/src/test/java/app)

## micro-couchbase

Another plugin that has been greatly enhanced. ManifestComparator has been made available as a Spring bean & some sample apps have been created.

See [micro-couchbase](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-couchbase) and [micro-couchbase example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-couchbase/src/test/java/app)

## micro-dbcp

DBCP support now separated into it’s own module - to allow optional configurability of connection pooling.

## Feature Tracking
- [micro-tomcat : Tomcat support](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/119)
- [micro-dbcp : DBCP support](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/114)
- [Jackson Initialization Order issue](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/122)
- [micro-events : Race condition in ActiveEvents](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/123)

## Dependency updates

None this time

name: v0.78 of Microserver
body:
# New in Microserver v0.78

## micro-machine-stats

Ready for the prime time! Now auto deploys Sigar in your Microservice and makes box load related information available via a Rest end point.

See [micro-machine-stats](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-machine-stats) and 
[Example micro-machine-stats apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-machine-stats/src/test/java/app)

## micro-couchbase

Another plugin that has been greatly enhanced. ManifestComparator has been made available as a Spring bean & some sample apps have been created.

See [micro-couchbase](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-couchbase) and [micro-couchbase example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-couchbase/src/test/java/app)

## micro-curator

A new readme.md and some sample apps to help you get started with this Curator / Zookeeper distributed lock impl.

See [micro-curator](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-curator) and [micro-curator example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-curator/src/test/java/app)

## micro-transactions

A beefed up API ([javadoc](http://www.javadoc.io/doc/com.aol.microservices/micro-transactions/0.78))

See [micro-transactions](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-transactions) and [micro-transactions example apps](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-transactions/src/test/java/app)

## micro-hikaricp

HikariCP support now separated into it’s own module - to allow optional configurability of connection pooling. micro-dbcp coming soon.

## Feature Tracking

[micro-events : SystemData should include the correlation id](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/103)
[micro-machine-stats : missing StatsResource end point](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/104)
[micro-machine-stats : StatsServletContextListener should be autodiscoverable](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/105)

## Dependency updates
- cyclops to 6.2.2
- Guava to 19.0-rc3
- Javaslang to 2.0.0-RC2
- Hibernate to 5.0.5.Final

# Getting Microserver

### Maven dependency

Microserver Grizzly with Jersey

```
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
  <artifactId>micro-grizzly-with-jersey</artifactId>
  <version>0.78</version>
</dependency>
```

Microserver Spring Boot 

```
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.aol.microservices</groupId>
  <artifactId>micro-boot</artifactId>
  <version>0.78</version>
</dependency>
```

Other modules are available in Maven Central


name: v0.77 of Microserver - Curator, Transactions & Jackson enhancements!
body:
# New in Microserver v0.77

# New Plugins!

## micro-curator

Use huge numbers of simultaneous distributed locks with Curator and Zookeeper

## micro-general-exception-mapper

Default & configurable exception handling

## micro-jackson-configuration

Default Jackson setup, configurable via a Spring bean

## micro-transactions

Functional / Java 8-Stream like Transaction handling

``` java
Integer result = TransactionFlow.of(transactionTemplate, this::load)
                                        .map(this::save)
                                        .execute(10)
                                        .get();
```

## Feature Tracking

[micro-client : Make readTimeout, connectTimeout, ConnectionRequestTimeout configurable](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/90)
[micro-events : remove thread id from the event id](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/92)
[micro-jdbc : make minimum idle for HikariCP configurable](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/94)

## Dependency updates
- cyclops to 6.2.1

name: v0.76 of Microserver
body:
# New in Microserver v0.76

## micro-application-register enhancements
- Host name configurable via a property (host.address)
- Registry can use caller ip addresses (set host.address=use-ip)

## micro-ip-tracker enhancements
- IP forwarding header configurable
- Filter mapping configurable

## micro-CORs enhancements
- EBay CORs filter now included and is the default

## micro-boot enhancements
- micro-boot apps (Microserver with Spring Boot) can now use the standard @Microserver annotation and configuration

## Dependency updates
- cyclops to 6.2.0
- simple-react to 0.99.5
- hikariCP to 2.4.2

## Feature Tracking
- [CORs module needs enhanced](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/72)
- [Make full standard Microserver configuration available to micro-boot](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/88)
- [Add endpoint field to registry information so VIPs / load balancers visible in application register](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/83)
- [Make VIP / Load balancer client IP forwarding header configurable](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/82)
- [Application Registry should optionally use sender's ip address instead of the send hostname](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/81)
- [Make host name configurable for application registry](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/80)

name: v0.73 of Microserver - micro-javaslang, micro-jdbc enhancements, version updates
body:
# New in Microserver v0.73

## micro-javaslang Plugin

New plugin to support Microservice development with Javaslang.
- Support for Jackson serialization and deserialization of Javaslang types
- [cyclops-javaslang](https://github.com/aol/cyclops/tree/master/cyclops-javaslang) included providing for-comprehensions, an abstraction over monads and reactive-streams support for Javaslang
- Reactive programming support for Javaslang Streams

## micro-jdbc enhancements
- [max pool size configurable for datasources](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/74)
- [remove spring-orm as a depencency](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/73)

## Dependency upgrades
- Spring Boot  to 1.3.0.RELEASE
- Spring to 4.2.3.RELEASE
- Hibernate to 5.0.4.Final
- logback to 1.1.3
- AspectJ to 1.8.7
- Spring Data to 1.9.1.RELEASE
- Guava to 19.0-rc2
- Spring metrics to 3.1.3
- Apache HTTP Client to 4.5.1
- Apache Async HTTP Client to 4.1.1

name: v0.69 of Microserver : jdbc / hibernate enhancements
body:
# New in Microserver v0.69
- micro-data plugin broken up into micro-jdbc and micro-hibernate

## micro-jdbc

Sets up a JDBC data source and Spring JdbcTemplate

## micro-hibernate

Configures both Spring-data to use Hibernate and a Hibernate SessionFactory

## Issues fixed :

https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/61
https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/62

Known issues : conflict with bean-validator included with Jersey and Hibernate 5.
Work around is to exclude the Jersey bean-validator when using micro-hibernate.

https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/65

name: v0.67 of Microserver
body:
# New in Microserver v0.67
- micro-mysql bug fixes 
  [mysql plugin JdbcConfigDistLock component name is wrong](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/59)
  mysql plugin doesn’t autowire all required Spring components automatically
  [Import correct plugin](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/commit/b9c4146296af42352d215bd359120228207f4e57)
- micro-application-register enhancement

name: v0.62 of Microserver : A plugin architecture and Microserver goes Reactive
body:
# New in Microserver v0.62

A new plugin Architecture and 11 plugins, with lots more to follow!
1. [micro-reactive](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-reactive) - reactive programming via Pipes (Queues & Topics) and Asyncrhonous Streams.
2. [micro-events](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-events) - capture scheduled jobs / active requests
3. [micro-data](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-data) - Spring Data, Hibernate and JDBC
4. [micro-metrics](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-metrics) - Dropwizard metrics for Spring
5. [micro-swagger](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-swagger)
6. [micro-client](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-client) - Async Rest Clients (NIO & Thread based)
7. [micro-grizzly](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-grizzly) - Grizzly Web server 
8. [micro-jersey](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-jersey) - Jersey jax-rs implementation
9. [micro-guava](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-guava) - Guava support (Jackson & Event bus configuration)
10. [micro-ip-tracker](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-ip-tracker)
11. [micro-cors](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/tree/master/micro-cors)

Other stuff!
1. [Users can create custom plugins](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/wiki/Creating-a-Microserver-plugin)
2. [Reactive Microserver first phase](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/wiki/Reactive-Microserver), with Reactive mixin that makes it easy to create performance optimised [simple-react](https://github.com/aol/simple-react) Streams
3. simple-react version upgraded to 0.98
4. Grizzly upgraded to version 2.3.21
5. Jersey upgraded to version 2.19

## Reactive Microserver

IO Bound Example, implement Reactive on your Rest Resource to inject Reactive capabilities!

```
@GET
@Produces("application/json")
public void mainfest(@Suspended AsyncResponse asyncResponse, @Context ServletContext context) {

    this.ioStream().of("/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF")
                .map(url->context.getResourceAsStream(url))
                .map(this::getManifest)
                .peek(result->asyncResponse.resume(result))
                .run();

}
```

Get a thread per I/O task, but each event chain operates with thread affinity for performance reasons.

## Pipes example

Create a bounded wait free Queue called "test"

```
    LazyFutureStream<String> stream = Pipes.registerForIO("test", QueueFactories.
                                        <String>boundedNonBlockingQueue(100)
                                            .build());
```

Create a batch processing Stream

```
    stream.sync() //do not distribute the next task to a task executor
          .filter(it->it!=null)
          .async() //now fan out across threads using a task executor
          .batchBySize(20)
          .sync() //any additional processing to continue on executing thread
          .map(this::save)
          .forEach(Logger::info);
    new MicroserverApp(()-> "simple-app").run();
```

In our Rest Resources pipe information to our processing Stream

```
  @Path("/status")
  @Rest
  public class PipesStatusResource implements Reactive {

      volatile int next=0;


      @GET
      @Produces("text/plain")
      @Path("/ping")
      public String ping() {
                this.enqueue("test",nextData());
                return "ok";
      }


  }
```

Microserver core

```
  <artifactId>micro-grizzly-with-jersey</artifactId>
  <version>0.62</version>

```

Instance level property file name now configurable  [#pull15](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/pull/15)

Fix shadowPlugin version https://github.com/aol/micro-server/issues/13
[Upgrade simple-react to v0.83](https://github.com/aol/simple-react/releases/tag/0.83)

## Configuring properties in Microserver

By default Microserver will attempt to load a file called [application.properties using the rules defined here](https://github.com/aol/micro-server/wiki/Defining-Properties) and file called instance.properties which also uses the same rules.

The disinction between the two is so that you can (optionally) have a separate properties files per group (e.g. Microservice type or entire cluster) and per instance. 

The property file name for both application.properties and instance.properties can be modified via the @Micrserver configuration annotation. 

The property instancePropertiesName is used to determine the instance properties resource  name.
The property propertiesName is used to determine the application type properties resource name.

name: v0.5 of Mircoserver
body:
# New in Microserver 0.5

Main launch class has been changed from MicroServerStartup to MicroserverApp

![screen shot 2015-03-11 at 9 44 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9964792/6607588/e6d24b74-c837-11e4-89a8-23c3a5130ce1.png)

## Spring Boot Integration

Spring Boot support is added with v0.5, so now you can launch a Spring Boot application that runs on a Grizzly Server with Jersey 2 and Microserver Jersey / Spring Integration. Your Spring Boot apps can also take advantage of Microserver optimisations and enhancements such as co-locating services with shared Spring resources (you might want to do this, to reduce consumption of scarce resources such as datasource connections to critical dbs).

## Bean validation

This version also includes validation via Jersey bean validation and hibernate validator.
